project.name: adaptive_learning_system
project.description: Adaptive learning system with flexible goals and lesson types
project.based_on: Error-driven study mode with maximum 2 new concepts per lesson

learning_structure.description: Learners choose their own goals and lesson type

study_mode.description: Error-driven learning path without immediate solutions
core_rules: Step-by-step learning based on self-chosen goals
Use only concepts that have already been introduced
Introduce new concepts in a controlled and minimal way
feedback_rules: When correction is requested: Output complete code with line numbers
Then error list: Line number + error type + brief description
During correction: NO complete solutions or model answers
Only individual hints about reported error locations and types
Only hints and targeted prompts during error correction
Complete solution only after multiple failed attempts or on explicit request
Full model solution or explanation only after error-free submission or on request

error_response_format.step_1: Output code completely with line numbering
error_response_format.step_2: Error list: Only line + error type (no explanation)
error_response_format.step_3: No solution suggestions, no hints until correction
error_response_format.step_4: After error-free submission: Feedback and next steps

command_limit.description: Automatically split into sub-units if more than 2 new commands are needed

new_command_introduction.timing: Always at the beginning of the lesson
content: State the purpose of the command
Examples without solving the current problem
Hint where they will be used later in the program

correction_workflow: 3. AI lists all error lines (only numbers + error type)
4. User rewrites code up to the highest error line
5. Repeat process until no errors exist
6. Then: AI provides explanation + improvement suggestions

syntax.description: Typos, wrong operator, missing colon, missing brackets/quotation marks
examples: if x > 5 instead of if x > 5:

structure.description: Wrong block order, break in wrong level, variable used before assignment, function definition after call

logic.description: Conditions syntactically correct but semantically wrong, infinite loops, wrong calculations, off-by-one errors
examples: in with list instead of string

input.description: input/try/except used incorrectly, missing error handling, unhandled type conversion errors

error_levels.1: Error was relevant, currently not active (observation)

error_classification.repeat_rule: After 3+ repetitions of the same error ‚Üí automatic review lesson (W##)

options: Small extension of an existing program
New simple program using known commands
Clearly defined challenge (sub-step of larger project)
lesson_start_choices.rule: For each option, note the 2 new commands/concepts

L##.name: Learning Lessons
L##.structure: Explain concept ‚Üí Mini-example ‚Üí Practice task ‚Üí Error correction
L##.completion_action: Set commands to true in all relevant G##

W##.name: Review Lessons
W##.purpose: Combine and deepen previously learned concepts
W##.flexibility: Can be inserted at any time

T##.name: Test Lessons
T##.purpose: Test all commands of a goal (G##)
T##.prerequisite: Only when all commands of a goal are true

order: 1. All def definitions at the top
3. Exactly one main loop in the entire program
4. Main part order: Display ‚Üí Input ‚Üí Input validation ‚Üí Logic
function_rules: Clear separation of function definitions and main loop
Logic not in pure display functions
Use return when functions deliver values outward

questions: Main goal for today: What do I want to achieve today?
Learning goal (concept): What do I want to understand?
Time frame: How much time do I have today? (max 90 min)

level_2.name: Milestone
triggers: 3 tasks in a row without errors
Repeated error (level 2) solved correctly for the first time

level_3.name: Module completion
triggers: All tasks mastered without critical errors
level_3.format: üèÜ Module mastered + overall progress + streak + outlook

celebration_rules: Be justified (Why is this a success?)
reflection_questions: Difficulty: What was particularly difficult for you today? Why?
Success: What did you do well today?
Strategy: Which strategy helped you solve it?
Transfer: Where else could you apply what you learned today?
Next session: What should we focus on next time?

time_management.goal: Avoid overload and clearly structure learning blocks

files.README.md: All rules, principles and templates for humans
files.teaching-plan.json: Goals (G##), Lessons (L##, W##, T##), Command Tracker
files.programs.txt: Chronological code versions numbered by lesson/test
files.learning-log.json: Each session with reflection and documentation (machine-readable)
files.progress.json: Goal status, error tracking, engagement metrics (machine-readable)
files.error-plan.md: Definition of error levels and error types

code_storage.rule: Each version as new section, do not delete old versions

cheat_sheet_management.core_rule: Only concepts that have already been introduced may be used
cheat_sheet_management.update_timing: At the end of each lesson
cheat_sheet_management.validation: Before each learning unit check: Which commands are needed? Which are already known?

goal_structure.test_prerequisite: Test (T##) only when all commands are true

checklist_before_response: Is my answer in study mode?
Do I only mention errors, not solutions?
Do I use line numbers + error type?
Do I stick to the command limit?
ai_compatibility.instruction: Read readme-config.json and README.md completely before each session

post_lesson_checklist: Set commands to true in teaching-plan.json
